page.title: 03St.Dunstans Church
page.content: Cranford Park has had a church since before the Domesday Book because the book shows what the priest owned.The church originally belonged to the Knights of St.John.It was called Cranford St.John.In the church is the tomb of the first lady Berkley and one for a man called Aston,who was Keeper of the Wardrobe to James 1.His tomb shows him and his family praying.In the nave there is a hatchment which was hung up on a house if a member of the family died.It would be carried in the funeral procession and then put in the local church.The chancel and the tower were built in the 14th century. The nave was burnt down and rebuilt in about 1715 in brick.The rest of the church is made of flint and pudding- stone.The oldest bell is dated about 1380.It is still used today.
